pull.title: BIP85: Clarify spec, correct PWD BASE64 test vector, add Portuguese language code
pull.body:
Summary of changes:
* Clarify drng_reader.read is a first-class function (not an evaluation)
* Clarify possibility for TPRV keys
* Add new reference implementation in Python
* Clarify that HD-Seed-WIF uses most significant bits
* Add language code for Portuguese under BIP-32 application
* Correct DERIVED ENTROPY for PWD BASE64 test vector.
  See the following relevant test cases:
    * [xfail on bad entropy from spec](https://github.com/akarve/bipsea/blob/5d5524acb0f4bea6af5fbc07bb05e620455d84c0/tests/test_bip85.py#L63)
    * [corrected and passing vector](https://github.com/akarve/bipsea/blob/5d5524acb0f4bea6af5fbc07bb05e620455d84c0/tests/test_bip85.py#L50)
 
Unit tests and complete implementation that led to these suggestions is in [akarve/bipsea](https://github.com/akarve/bipsea).

labels.name: Pending acceptance
labels.description: This BIP modification requires sign-off by the champion of the BIP being modified

events.message: Clarify and correct a few items in BIP-85

events.message: Clarify spec, correct test vector in BIP-85 (#1)
don't mention DRNG path format as ever path implies a unique DRNG
Testnet consistency; no derivation path for DRNG since each path implies a DRNG

events.body: Happy to remove my implementation from reference implementations per #1580 but on review I think you will find that my implementation is more complete and unit-tested than the original. I was also unable to get the original to run at all after install.

I will be very happy to hear from @ethankosakovsky but he hasn't been active on GH since 2021. I have no idea if there's a procedure for this, nevertheless I volunteer to become a maintainer of this BIP if the author cannot be reached.

rename.from: BIP85: Clarify spec, correct PWD BASE64 test vector entropy
rename.to: BIP85: Clarify spec, correct PWD BASE64 test vector, add Portuguese language code

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -223,9 +228,14 @@ OUTPUT
 Application number: 32'
 
 Taking 64 bytes of the HMAC digest, the first 32 bytes are the chain code, and second 32 bytes[1] are the private key for BIP32 XPRV value. Child number, depth, and parent fingerprint are forced to zero.
+(Note that this ordering is opposite BIP32, where the chain code is the least significant 32 bytes.)
comments.body:
I'm looking for guidance as to whether or not we change the order in this spec and update the corresponding XPRV test vector (that's what I'd recommend) or just make a note?

You can verify that BIP-32 is the opposite [here](https://github.com/bitcoin/bips/blob/master/bip-0032.mediawiki). Under CKDpriv and CKDpub BIP-32 states:

> "The returned chain code ci is IR."

R is for right. You will also see "most significant byte first" throughout BIP-32 indicating "big endian". BIP85 is also big endian, it states "Truncate trailing (least significant) bytes."

I have all BIP-32 and the (backwards?) BIP-85 vectors passing. Here you can see the tested CKDpriv implementation takes [the first 32 bytes for the chain code](https://github.com/akarve/bipsea/blob/5d5524acb0f4bea6af5fbc07bb05e620455d84c0/src/bipsea/bip32.py#L136) and the also passing BIP-85 implementation takes the [last 32 bytes for the chain code](https://github.com/akarve/bipsea/blob/5d5524acb0f4bea6af5fbc07bb05e620455d84c0/src/bipsea/bip85.py#L108).

I hope I'm not missing something obvious?
